snippet: Explosions in Aleppo signaled that forces seeking the Syrian government’s overthrow can strike at the very seat of its power.
abstract: Powerful car bombs explode outside two security headquarters in the northern Syrian city of Aleppo, killing 28 people, including military personnel, civilians and children; attacks signal that emboldened forces seeking the government's overthrow can strike at the very seat of its power.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and an employee of The New York Times from Beirut, Alan Cowell from London and Elisabeth Bumiller from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Explosions in Aleppo signaled that forces seeking the Syrian government’s overthrow can strike at the very seat of its power.

headline.seo: Blasts Rock Aleppo as Dozens More Are Reported Killed in Syria
headline.main: 2 Security Complex Car Bombings Kill Dozens, Syria Says
headline.print_headline: 2 Car Bombings at a Security Complex Kill Dozens, Syria Says
